alert.note: Alert for Ozark (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 25 at 10:32AM CDT until March 29 at 7:31PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in south central Missouri, Howell, Oregon and Shannon. In southwest Missouri, Ozark. * WHEN...Until midnight CDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1031 AM CDT, The Department of Transportation reported flooding from previous heavy rain in the warned area. - This includes the following low water crossings... Lick Creek at County Road 528, Howell Creek at County Road 9790, Spring Creek at County Road 349, Mahans Creek at County Road 501, Middle Fork Eleven Point River at County Road 1420, Possum Walk Creek at Highway T and Warm Fork Spring River at County Road 323. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Plains, Mountain View, Thayer, Willow Springs, Winona, Alton, Gainesville, Birch Tree, Eminence, Bakersfield, Pomona, South Fork, Koshkonong, Brandsville, Montier, Thomasville, Rover, Peace Valley, White Church, Teresita, Lanton, Greer, Couch, Pottersville, Siloam Springs, Alley Spring, Moody, West Eminence, Caulfield, Wilderness, Myrtle, Dora, Sycamore, Udall, Tecumseh, Zanoni, Hardenville, Norfork Lake, Grand Gulf State Park and Ozark National Scenic Riverways. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
